intro: Bupleurum baldense subsp. opacum, commonly known as the opaque bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
